alert.note: Alert for East Valley; Northwest Pinal County; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 06 at 5:17PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 600 PM MST... At 517 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Queen Creek, or 7 miles southeast of Gilbert, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs, blow around unsecured objects, and generate blowing dust. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Sun Lakes, Queen Creek, Chandler Heights, Tumbleweed Park, San Tan Village Mall, Seville, Phoenix Mesa Gateway Airport, San Tan Mountain Park, Higley and Santan. This includes the following highways... AZ Route 87 between mile markers 149 and 164. AZ Route 202 between mile markers 35 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: East Valley; Northwest Pinal County; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek
